<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An or instruction, which can be marked as &quot;disjoint&quot;, indicating that the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// inputs don&#39;t have a 1 in the same bit position. Meaning this instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// can also be treated as an add.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/possiblydisjointinst"><span class="doxyHighlight">class <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/possiblydisjointinst">PossiblyDisjointInst</a> : public <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#acee1035fe1c77f85d4b80655e4df150a">BinaryOperator</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// casts. It is simply provided so that instruction category testing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// can be performed with code like:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// if (isa&lt;CastInst&gt;(Instr)) &#123; ... &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Base class of casting instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst/#a8eadc0b6c1d49a31d389dd611f44b08f">CastInst</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unaryinstruction/#ad93ca9b74c44e7d8c00c72405e51262d">UnaryInstruction</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#ae65337bd76ece9e7b1d20cf665bfa742">CmpInst</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#ae70f02adcd410ca9c8429fa8d7711965">Instruction</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This enumeration lists the possible predicates for CmpInst subclasses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Values in the range 0-31 are reserved for FCmpInst, while values in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// range 32-64 are reserved for ICmpInst. This is necessary to ensure the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="668"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// predicate values are not overlapping between the classes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="669"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Some passes (e.g. InstCombine) depend on the bit-wise characteristics of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FCMP&#95;&#42; values. Changing the bit patterns requires a potential change to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="672"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// those passes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="673" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b">Predicate</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Opcode            U L G E    Intuitive operation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="675" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78bae9c013750fff3023001d7e3af8df2d6d"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78bae9c013750fff3023001d7e3af8df2d6d">FCMP&#95;FALSE</a> = 0, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 0 0 0    Always false (always folded)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba024db78a5ed74f64666f3ca4955e6eca"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba024db78a5ed74f64666f3ca4955e6eca">FCMP&#95;OEQ</a> = 1,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 0 0 1    True if ordered and equal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba4c399f525bbcf03d72af4b303e6eeca8"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba4c399f525bbcf03d72af4b303e6eeca8">FCMP&#95;OGT</a> = 2,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 0 1 0    True if ordered and greater than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba541533f34077bbbcfb703a90f6d2da9b"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba541533f34077bbbcfb703a90f6d2da9b">FCMP&#95;OGE</a> = 3,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 0 1 1    True if ordered and greater than or equal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba326bee0a4a424cef21c1cf8adb8b8dd8"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba326bee0a4a424cef21c1cf8adb8b8dd8">FCMP&#95;OLT</a> = 4,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 1 0 0    True if ordered and less than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba9835cfe02fb5027680bd7203b024f77a"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba9835cfe02fb5027680bd7203b024f77a">FCMP&#95;OLE</a> = 5,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 1 0 1    True if ordered and less than or equal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba8a80b27ca29fe2076b9bbdee02c65464"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba8a80b27ca29fe2076b9bbdee02c65464">FCMP&#95;ONE</a> = 6,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 1 1 0    True if ordered and operands are unequal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78baa3213b645e029aba8bb1b85213607d5e"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78baa3213b645e029aba8bb1b85213607d5e">FCMP&#95;ORD</a> = 7,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 0 1 1 1    True if ordered (no nans)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba959268ceeae23abe5c9ad9e895669d0c"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba959268ceeae23abe5c9ad9e895669d0c">FCMP&#95;UGT</a> = 10,  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///&lt; 1 0 1 0    True if unordered or greater than</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Base class for all callable instructions (InvokeInst and CallInst)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Holds everything related to calling a function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// All call-like instructions are required to use a common operand layout:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Zero or more arguments to the call,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Zero or more operand bundles with zero or more operand inputs each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   bundle,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Zero or more subclass controlled operands</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - The called function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This allows this base class to easily access the called function and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// start of the arguments without knowing how many other operands a particular</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// subclass requires. Note that accessing the end of the argument list isn&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// as cheap as most other operations on the base class.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a8a6c9c1339e7a196e0ae69031426c083">CallBase</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#ae70f02adcd410ca9c8429fa8d7711965">Instruction</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">protected</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The first two bits are reserved by CallInst for fast retrieval,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca2f101663d054cffa9c9956f30e7ecf7d">CallingConv::MaxID</a>&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1120"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bitfield/#a3a98703db928a3d2cb2dbc2868893f05">Bitfield::areContiguous&lt;CallInstReservedField, CallingConvField&gt;</a>(),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1121"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Bitfields must be contiguous&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The last operand is the called operand.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1638"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if the data operand at index \\p i has the attribute \\p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1639"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1640"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1641"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Data operands include call arguments and values used in operand bundles,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1642"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// but does not include the callee operand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1643"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1644"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The index \\p i is interpreted as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1645"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1646"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  \\p i in &#91;0, arg&#95;size)  -&gt; argument number (\\p i)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1647"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  \\p i in &#91;arg&#95;size, data&#95;operand&#95;size) -&gt; bundle operand at index</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1648"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     (\\p i) in the operand list.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1649" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a590b8b0d5d2ae53eeb6f290d7395c71c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a590b8b0d5d2ae53eeb6f290d7395c71c">dataOperandHasImpliedAttr</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> i, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/attribute/#aab7ee4b8fd1d3e7e4cea87868855e60e">Attribute::AttrKind</a> Kind)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1650"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that we have to add one because &#96;i&#96; isn&#39;t zero-indexed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1651"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(i &lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#adde2ea00dd2613ee41bfe91908e4e68e">arg&#95;size</a>() + <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#aff4a43d51265443e3d62d49395d0b585">getNumTotalBundleOperands</a>() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1652"><span class="doxyHighlight">           </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Data operand index out of bounds!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1653"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1654"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The attribute A can either be directly specified, if the operand in</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return the start of the list of BundleOpInfo instances associated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// with this OperandBundleUser.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// OperandBundleUser uses the descriptor area co-allocated with the host User</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to store some meta information about which operands are &quot;normal&quot; operands,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and which ones belong to some operand bundle.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The layout of an operand bundle user is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          +-----------uint32&#95;t End-------------------------------------+</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          |                                                            |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          |  +--------uint32&#95;t Begin--------------------+              |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          |  |                                          |              |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          ^  ^                                          v              v</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  |------|------|----|----|----|----|----|---------|----|---------|----|-----</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  | BOI0 | BOI1 | .. | DU | U0 | U1 | .. | BOI0&#95;U0 | .. | BOI1&#95;U0 | .. | Un</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  |------|------|----|----|----|----|----|---------|----|---------|----|-----</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   v  v                                  ^              ^</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   |  |                                  |              |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   |  +--------uint32&#95;t Begin------------+              |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   |                                                    |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   +-----------uint32&#95;t End-----------------------------+</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BOI0, BOI1 ... are descriptions of operand bundles in this User&#39;s use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// list. These descriptions are installed and managed by this class, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// they&#39;re all instances of OperandBundleUser&lt;T&gt;::BundleOpInfo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DU is an additional descriptor installed by User&#39;s &#39;operator new&#39; to keep</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// track of the &#39;BOI0 ... BOIN&#39; co-allocation.  OperandBundleUser does not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// access or modify DU in any way, it&#39;s an implementation detail private to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// User.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The regular Use&amp; vector for the User starts at U0.  The operand bundle</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// uses are part of the Use&amp; vector, just like normal uses.  In the diagram</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// above, the operand bundle uses start at BOI0&#95;U0.  Each instance of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BundleOpInfo has information about a contiguous set of uses constituting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// an operand bundle, and the total set of operand bundle uses themselves</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// form a contiguous set of uses (i.e. there are no gaps between uses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// corresponding to individual operand bundles).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This class does not know the location of the set of operand bundle uses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// within the use list -- that is decided by the User using this class via</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the BeginIdx argument in populateBundleOperandInfos.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Currently operand bundle users with hung-off operands are not supported.</span></CodeLine>
